segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second, and he doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is standing right there, waiting for him to hand her a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how reckless he’s being, all for a few cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just a few feet away, completely unaware of what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the sink is getting closer to them, and the floor is already wet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they don’t slip and hurt themselves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, even though I know something bad might happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
